I was told I had to stay and I just wandered from the dumpster and the bigger trash bin for a few hours cause they had nothing for me to do)

job_title: Financial Assistant II in Milwaukee, WI
pros: If you're a bully and brown-noser you'll go places. Most employees that aren't "leadership" are decent people. They throw pizza down your throat once a year.
cons: "As long as a manager isn't doing anything illegal MCW hr won't take any action" MCW Ombuds. I've heard that quote a few times from anyone that's gone to ombuds with issues. If you're having issues with a manager just leave the dept or the whole place. I had worked dumped on me from employees quiting, fired and dying; my job description never changed and when I finally asked for a raise and asked if the administrator had issues with me (since she never talked to me) I was told my job was being eliminated due to "tough economic times". I was encouraged to end my paternal leave early (my mistake) and when my son was sick and I had to be out for 4 days I was denied short term leave and got a demerit. I was there for 9 years, applied for 200+ positions and never got a promotion.

job_title: Research Program Coordinator II in Milwaukee, WI
pros: Good benefits, professional development and growth opportunities, flexible hours
cons: Hard to make work life balance, often understaffed

pros: Paid parking Kind coworkers decent hours
cons: Low pay, no time flexibility

job_title: Clinical Coordinator II in Wauwatosa, WI
pros: Alright pay and benefits. Office is clean. Opportunities to learn. Good place for administrative work if you like to have a nice cubicle
cons: Penny pinchers, clear hierarchy/caste system of employees, office politics are extremely conservative, employee feedback falls of deaf ears and blind eyes. Inconsistencies between culture & value declarations vs actions.

pros: flexibility to work from home many collaboration opportunities
cons: cold weather in the winter time

pros: MDs are wonderful with patients amd staff. Mission is clearly communicated. Hybrid work is helpful for balance. Benefits are good, yet costly if you have to pay the spouse surcharge.
cons: Admins are under appreciated and for those with 20+ yrs of experience, undercompensated. Need to build up support staff after Covid staff releases. Work to retain those admin stars that are leaving.

job_title: Certified Professional Coder in Milwaukee, WI
pros: Stable, support from management, great work/life balance

pros: I can't think of one.
cons: You can hold unpopular opinions and disagree with the CEO, but be careful if you speak those thoughts. MCW IS is monitoring all your communications and you *will* be reported to HR for potential discipline or dismissal. But first, your supervisor will be called in for secret meetings with HR and instructed to make you stop saying the things that are making the CEO unhappy. Then you will have one of those meetings with a script straight out of a mafia movie: "nice little academic career you've built here, shame if something were to happen to it..."

pros: The staff are very helpful and for the most part people enjoy working here.
cons: My work is sometimes not the most intellectually stimulating.

job_title: PhD Graduate Student in Milwaukee, WI
pros: Good mentorship Free tuition Health benefits
cons: A lack of departmental communication

pros: You get the experience of working alongside medical personnel and colleagues who share the same passion as you.
cons: The environment depending on the team can be extremely toxic and full of micromanagers who know how to maneuver their way into staying under the radar unfortunately from having to visit HR. The organization does not recognize and acknowledge individuals are severely underpaid for the type of work that is done. Advancement opportunities are a taboo topic - if a manager does not want his or her employees to progress forward, they will do everything they can to maliciously sabotage the opportunity. Retaliation is real at this company and employees do not feel safe to report the concerns.

pros: Great benefits and work life balance.
cons: There is often a lot of turnover

pros: Laid back, flexible, interesting research

pros: Collegial & great work environment for research and teaching. There is good work/life balance There is an inclusive and diverse environment.

review_title: Job is rewarding, pay is insultingly low
job_title: Clinical Research Coordinator in Milwaukee, WI
pros: The people are very nice and helpful. The work is rewarding.
cons: There is absolutely no wiggle room on pay. Apparently there is a fixed number for each position determined by HR and even if your manager tries to get you more money, HR denies it. Very weird pay system.. it might be an excuse from management to wash their hands of the conversation. No bonuses, no overtime. The amount of work you have to do is NOT worth the pay however the patients and coworkers help.

job_title: Clinical Research Coordinator I in Milwaukee, WI
pros: Coworkers are nice when you have time to interact with them.
cons: Working long hours and weekends without compensation. Chronically understaffed due to high workload and LOW pay. Management states they are "aware things are hard and are working to increase pay" but have been saying that for years but nothing changes. Expect empty promises and guilt trips from upper management. Be prepared, you will be set up to fail.

review_title: Fantastic opportunity on paper, EXTREMELY disappointing in reality
job_title: Clinical Research Coordinator in Milwaukee, WI
pros: Potential for rewarding clinical research and patient-facing experience.
cons: Workload distribution amongst staff is incredibly disproportionate and overwhelming. Constant turnover only adds to already overburdening expectations. Lack of employees with 1+ years of experience due to insulting pay, burnout, and indifferent management should be seen as a glaring red flag.

job_title: HIV PrEP Navigator in Milwaukee, WI
pros: In field of HIV care and prevention, the team at MCW is unmatched. The social service leadership is so compassionate and supportive, I've never had the privilege of such a caring work environment before. They have really great benefits, including 8% retirement contributions from the employer.
cons: It can be emotionally heavy work, which is true of any social work role. I found clinical care roles to be too inflexible (and that's despite our role was perhaps the most flexible on the social service team as a whole).

job_title: Clinical Research Assistant III in Milwaukee, WI

Management and apparently HR are very resistant to give you a promotion that is more than one position above your current (even when it is well deserved, and you can demonstrate you're actually already doing that job). job_title: Clinical Research Coordinator in Milwaukee, WI
pros: Great people, amazing medical center
cons: Head management does not value employees and are clueless on emotional state of staff

pros: a great ambulatory surgery center
cons: an expansive community hospital network to manage

pros: Great culture, 90% of the people are very nice
cons: Promotions are scarce due to personnel not leaving

job_title: Patient Service Representative in Milwaukee, WI
pros: Thorough training and education, opportunities to advance
cons: No cons- very busy hospital system so be prepared for a fast paced environment

pros: Good work environment, nice people
cons: career development, other things are ok

pros: Great benefits, great company, great communication!
cons: I have not found any cons yet

pros: Friendly leaders, competitive salary, great work environment
cons: Slow to get things done

job_title: Clinical Research Coordinator II in Milwaukee, WI
pros: Potential for growth; average pay;
cons: high work expectations; lack of diversity in leadership

job_title: Clinical Research Coordinator I in Milwaukee, WI
pros: Great company and management to work.
cons: Early in time on somedays

job_title: Senior Administrative Assistant in Milwaukee, WI
pros: Flexible, great collaborators, up to date
cons: Staff are not always treated as well as faculty

job_title: Diversity and Inclusion Manager in Milwaukee, WI
pros:
Mission-driven 
Focused on excellence
Growth potential
cons:
Hierarchical 
Slow-paced 
Complex and inefficient leadership structure

pros: Excellent Pay good team to work for
cons: Long hours and expensive insurance

pros: Teaching. Attached to MSA program. Variety in practice locations
cons:
Inflexible 
Political issues with crnas

pros: salary, benefits, commitment to health and community
cons: staff are treated worse than faculty

review_title: HORRIBLE! All depends on your direct manager
job_title: Clinical Research Coordinator II in Milwaukee, WI
pros: MCW has a few good qualities such as their benefits package, if you work in administration you are 'supposed' to have a good work/life balance.
cons: The compensation they offer employees is horrible.  It also all depends on who your direct manager is.   If you are offered a job in Emergency Medicine Research TURN IT DOWN! You will be worked like a slave, you will not be granted the days off you requested - worse, you will be told you can take vacation and then at the last minute told that you cannot. It is a very 'cliquey' environment.  My program manager was also very controlling and verbally abusive.  If he found out that you talked to his boss, instead of him, he would corner you in his office and yell at your for not following the rules of the 'hierarchy'.   We also never received annual reviews and never received feedback on our work.  HR needs to do a much better job looking at their managers and listening to the employees feedback - certain people should not be managing others.

pros: Great team dynamic & work ethic
cons: Not applicable at the moment

job_title: Clinical Research Assistant II in Milwaukee, WI
pros: organized, nice staff, interesting, good intent
cons: low pay, okay insurance compared to aurora

job_title: Clinical Research Coordinator in Milwaukee, WI
pros: Great place to work at.
cons: There are no cons, its a great place.

job_title: Community Programs Coordinator in Milwaukee, WI
pros: learning campus and opportunities to grow
cons: working on grants can be difficult based on pay

pros: Good work environment and facilities
cons: high work load and tough deadlines

review_title: Inclusive but not sure of transparency
job_title: Program Coordinator III in Milwaukee, WI
pros: The benefits are hands down, second to none.  From health to dental, wellness to discounts and programs for back-up care... MCW really covers it all.  The costs are low, too, and there are multiple levels of insurance coverage to be purchased for medical, dental, and vision.  Because it's an educational institution, I felt supported in my desire to obtain an additional degree.  I also had the opportunity to draw from a wide pool of professionals as a mentor.
cons: Staff and Faculty working together.  Many faculty are MDs and feel they are better than staff members despite the staff person having years of experience and credentials asserting their expertise.  Some issues with transparency at the department level, particularly with life-long employees.  The benefits are SO good that I think some people refuse to leave therefore making everyone around them suffer.

job_title: Clinical Research Coordinator in Wauwatosa, WI
pros: Diverse, good leadership, challenging, professional
cons: Depending on the boss, they can be quite strict on time management.

job_title: Research Technologist I in Milwaukee, WI
pros: Challenging job, never got bored, good benefits
cons: High rate of turnover, low base pay

pros: Flexibility (some), good benefits, I honestly have been very disapointed since I started here.
cons: Depending on the department you work in, you could have entirely different experiences.  Every department is it's own silo with its own managment.  My department in particular is extremely dysfunctional and HR refuses to step in and fix anything unless it is a legal issue.  Turnover doesn't seem to bother anyone.  Basic HR policies aren't followed yet when I brought this up with HR they didn't care.  There is no leadership in my department and employees seem to do whatever they want with no repercussions.  Very difficult to move up the career laddar or into another department.  Will be looking to move on ASAP.

pros: Though some will complain that benefits aren't as good as they once were, for many staff they are still very good/competitive in current market. It offers an opportunity to work in an environment where individuals, be them faculty, researchers, or staff can all contribute to initiatives that improve health, education, research and patient care.
cons: Research support is poor. There are few staff opportunities for advancement. Professional development is preached but seldom practiced. Annual performance evaluations as currently implemented are abstract, subjective and borderline useless to management and staff alike. Some areas like IS and HR are high turnover and understaffed. Compensation and culture vary from area to area. The worst are quite bad, but the best are outstanding. MCW is massive, but this explains why reviews and experiences differ so widely.

review_title: Relaxed working environment, limited career advance opportunaties
job_title: Research Scientist II in Milwaukee, WI
pros: As a regular staff (not faculty, not medical professionals), working for the college gives you all the perks of working for an academic institution. In general, the working environment is relaxed. Most of your work days are not intense. You do not have too many deadlines to catch. You can pretty much work with your own pace as long as you complete all you assigned task to the managers satisfaction. Health insurance plan is decent, you get to pay very little copay.
cons:
The whole college evolves around physicians. As such, the college does not provide much career advancement opportunities for regular staffs. Even you get above average job performance review, you are not promoted unless there is 'quota'/budget available. Physicians can take any classes offered by the college for free without any approval from any one, yet the same benefit are not offered to staff. 
Don't expect much about your salary or employee benefits other than the health insurance. In the median to low range of the market.

pros: True sense of mission among clinical staff and faculty. The flow of ideas from research to practice is fun to be part of. The faculty really care about their patients and the organization. There can be a good deal of freedom to pursue independent projects as long as in alignment with the missions.
cons: The experience of MCW is quite variable depending on the department and position. . Another factor is that departments or staff can be moved to the Froedtert or Children's organizations which means employees lose MCW employment and benefits but generally are offered equivalent jobs at the hospital systems. When these mergers occur, Froedtert and Children's generally are welcoming to MCW transferees and seniority is maintained. However, be aware that a position in the clinical practice at MCW could be moved at any time to a partner institution.

review_title: Medical College Offers Excellent Benefits, But Lacks in Payroll and Respect for Employees
job_title: Administrative Assistant III in Milwaukee, WI
pros: Excellent benefits. Interesting work. Good cause (patient care, reserach,etc). Tuition reimbursement.
cons: Poor pay. Lack of personal growth opportunities. Little to no recognition/compensation for good performance. Little to no promotional opportunities (they usually list your job at the higher level and you have to "apply like everyone else " to keep your jop--hopefully). Not much flexibility in work schedule in most positions/departments.

pros: I worked here from mid-April 2015 to mid-Nov 2015 as a temp. employee.  The position was pitched to my by the staffing agency as being temp-with a high likelihood of going permanent.  Well, things suddenly got very reshuffled and that prospect went out the window.  The departments are very siloed,  there can be a lot of political bickering when change comes about.  The departments I'm in are slowly transitioning from being very "old boy's club" to something more inclusive and modern, and there are growing pains.  That being said, it seems that the permanent employees are mostly satisfied with the way the company takes care of them/the perks/etc.
cons: Opaque management.  Redundancy. Slow to change. Redundancy.

pros: Easy to collaborate between labs and even departments, as well as between Physicians and PhDs (aside from occasional restrictions due to politics).
cons:
A significant portion of many scientists' time is spent securing and maintaining NIH funding.  The smaller the lab, the longer it takes to generate enough preliminary data to write a grant and most first-submissions score too low and need to be revised - this process can take months and even years as newly appointed faculty scramble to get funded.

Lastly, and this is the reason I left academics for the private sector, I saw a brilliant Assistant Professor fail for 6 years to get funded despite an impressive publication record.  My mentor brought him into our lab to give him one more chance to get funded and so I had the opportunity to do some of the molecular work for his newest grant.  He is a brilliant scientist and the thought of him losing tenure just terrifies me.

job_title: Public Safety Officer in Wauwatosa, WI
pros:
-High pay for security field, around $17 starting
-Ample overtime 
-Easy job, guarantee not to get fired as long as you show up and do the minimum amount of work required 
-Benefits are good
-Lots of free time to watch videos, read, get your degree online while at work
cons:
-Management has no front line security or law enforcement work leaving them out of touch 
-Department staffing is almost 50% “supervisors”, very top heavy
-Members of management behave like the department is a police department, taking actions that should be left to the real police instead of handling them internally
-Management nitpicks the smallest things because nothing of importance happens
-Absolutely no sense of professional meaning with this job. Worked for three years with this department and left feeling like I made a difference maybe once or twice.  Got hired on by a large police department and literally accomplished more in a day at the new job than I did during my entire time at MCW

review_title: The HMGC was not what I expected
job_title: Systems Specialist III in Milwaukee, WI
pros: Good compensation. There were 3 people that I worked with in the HMGC that were always helpful and I could always confide in them. Kim, Kerry, and Jennifer.
cons:
Decentralized IT meant conflicting directives
No structure to doing things
Staff was resistant to changes I tried to implement
No control over the budget, which I felt was not justified for a senior level role
Nothing was documented
No real standards were followed
Took too long to get hardware ordered
Had to rely too much on old hardware due to grant-based funding
Little to no support from the then-HMGC interim administrator and the Department Chair for Physiology
Everything was done manually, which meant more mistakes
IT was the last area in the HMGC/Department of Physiology to get any kind of funding
No real lifecycle management for the IT assets
Doctors get top billing over everyone else

job_title: Research Associate I in Milwaukee, WI
pros: The people are generally great to work with.  One of the very few places in the Milwaukee area for biotechnology.
cons:
Low pay. Benefits eroding. Too top heavy. Near impossible to get a raise or promotion unless you're working for a manager who is willing to go to bat for you.

I ended up getting fired ("voluntarily resigned") because I refused the flu shot. If you don't mind not having a choice in getting the flu shot then by all means, get a job at MCW. I was in my first trimester of pregnancy with a strong family history of autoimmune diseases. My medical exemptions - one signed by my primary care provider the other signed by my midwife - were both denied as the reason didn't comply with CDC guidelines. To add, I had zero patient contact so the risk of transmission was the same as going to the grocery store.

pros: Opportunities for advancement.  Market analysis done on salaries.
cons: There can be some very “intense” people you could work for so proceed with caution.  Make sure to ask different questions as to why the position is open and pay attention to body language.  There is a lack of support from MCW HR department when there are issues with a higher up personnel however the Ombudsman’s office is very supportive and provides guidance.

pros: High quality biomedical research. Numerous core facilities for shared resources. Opportunities for collaborations with other labs and departments exist.
cons: Department of Medicine is too large, and as a consequence is poorly managed and lacks any sense of cohesion or camaraderie. Choose a different department if possible. With a nonexistent institutional culture, experience will depend entirely on lab chosen and department. Choose carefully. Also, taking time for growth opportunities outside of the lab (e.g. teaching, etc.) is strongly discouraged by the institution, even if done on your own time (evenings, weekends). If interested in developing non-bench skills, find a PI who encourages and values such endeavors, or be prepared to keep these activities hidden.

pros: MCW is a great company overall. Good mission and innovation, solid benefits and training for employees, good learning for students, faculty and reseachers
cons: HR Leadership and HR Leadership. This team needs help and it starts at the top. I like my job but the environment is toxic. If you are critical of the leaders they will target you by changing your job, changing your workspace, getting rid of you, marking you down on reviews etc. Retaliation is rampant. It's scary and not how the rest of MCW is. Please protect your employees and take action.

job_title: IS Manager II in Milwaukee, WI
pros: Working with a community of  gifted care providers that strive to provide the best care.  Intellectual community where opinions are sought out and respected.  Benefits package is very generous.
cons: Academic community is not necessarily the best group for people management.  Large egos and little oversight can drastically change a department's culture for the worse.  The opportunities for advancement can be quite limited.  I find myself looking for an exit after 15 years on campus.

review_title: Nice place to start a career but don't plan to stay
pros: 3 weeks vacation time and 9 sick days a year at the start. If allowed by the current department lots of chances to move to other positions.
cons: Vacation time is great but you have to be able to use it.  Even while on vacation plan on checking emails and answering phone calls.  Raises are not based on job performance or reviews.  Workforce bullying is prevalent.

review_title: They don't really value support staff
job_title: Medical Education Coordinator in Milwaukee, WI
pros: The work they do is highly respected
cons: HR practices are decentralized which puts a lot of power in departmental administration's hands, making for uneven, and unfair application of "rules". Departmental favorites are given a lot of room to maneuver while others are held to the letter of the law. I witnessed a few coworkers being "set up to fail" by constantly moving the goal posts and then writing them up. Cowards at the top hide behind this so long as the department is making money.

job_title: Systems Specialist II in Wauwatosa, WI
pros: Generally a good place to work, with good benefits and employee policies.
cons: As of 2015 the College is expanding and changing very quickly, and some employees are being left behind. Even if you're enthusiastic and willing to change, the direction of change is out of your control (right now) and management is too busy with future plans to listen to people. Also, attrition may result in some employees having an unusual, and unsatisfying, mix of incompatible duties and tasks.

pros: Dept. of Neurosurgery is amazing - really enjoyed working under my PI. I had really fun and challenging projects as well as a diverse array of projects.
cons: I get the sense that MCW executives don't put forth much effort to make it easy on the researcher. Can be difficult to get funding with the high institutional costs. MCW's vision also seems a little unclear in terms of research.

review_title: The Medical College of Wisconsin has fostered my career development
pros:
Passionate directors, management and colleagues who foster professional growth,
Ability to take on new tasks to broaden exposure,
Excellent benefits package (PTO, retirement & insurance),
Academic/research environment is empowering
cons:
Bureaucratic structure can sometimes inhibit processes from moving as smoothly as they could,
Compensation is lower than local competition,
Some technologies used are outdated

pros: Job stability, good (but declining) health coverage. Excellent research facilities.
cons: Highly inbred academic environment. Some departments are staffed mainly by faculty who did all their training right here. Many, many underperforming staff in administrative and other support positions (even lab research personnel) are retained despite embarrassingly low productivity and incompetence.

pros: The benefits while working at MCW were fantastic, as long as you never left the Milwaukee, WI area or needed healthcare when you were traveling.  The work/ife balance was good, I never had to work past 5 and did not have to think of work at all when I was not there.  Very low responsibility for my position, so very little stress.  Job security was good and most people were at least pleasant.
cons: Walking to and from the parking lot was definitely not something I looked forward to, but it was not too bad.

review_title: Postdoctoral Research Fellow, Medical Physics - Medical College of Wisconsin/ Radiation Oncology
pros: There are quality doctors and staff in other departments who do their jobs professionally.
cons: Radiation Oncology Department lacks leadership.  There is a clear toxic environment at the Medical Physics section of the Radiation Oncology Department. There is clear racial discrimination and the key positions are being given to the mediocre candidates of certain etnicity who have no prior education in US.  The abusing of the postdocs by constantly humiliating and degrading them is common. There is no democratic environment in the department and many people leave their positions shortly after joining his group.  If you want to ruin your life, go ahead and work here.

job_title: Patient Service Representative in Milwaukee, WI
pros: Better benefits than most comparable facilities.
cons: Management team is quite the bully.  Demeaning and uncaring behavior which seems to go unnoticed even with supporting evidence and documentation.  Difficult to advance or promote unless management really likes you for reasons beyond the scope of the job.

review_title: If you supervisor liked you, you got away with everything.
pros: Alot of variety of duties - no day was ever the same. The benefits once were good but they took alot of that away.
cons: I worked very hard as others with the same title did not.  As my day was always non-stop busy with duties, others sat around alot or passed off their work. If manager liked that group, they got away with it consistently.

review_title: A good place to work...unless you work in HR
pros: Good benefits, good people in most areas of the org, good leaders and good technology
cons: The HR department is horrible, turn over is incredibly high in that department and the leadership team including the directors in HR treat people very poorly.

job_title: Senior Administrative Assistant in Wauwatosa, WI
pros: The pay and benefits were awesome when I worked there but since leaving I have heard that the benefits aren't as great as they used to be.
cons: It can be hard to get time off and the department I was in had a constant rotation of employees so tasks were constantly being shifted since they couldn't keep people long.

pros: I can't think of any good reasons
cons: An do as I say not as I do attitude

pros: Great place to work.  Opportunity for education and advancement.  Supervisors were great people, environment was pleasant, generous benefit package.
cons: Few cons.  The commute through the city was very congested. Remote work not available, however I understand this is now offered.  I wish it was offered in other states remotely.

review_title: The college has a great mission, good people working for it.  excellent school for medical students.
pros:
Very stable - healthcare is always needed.
Good benefits package.
Good amount of vacation time.
You work in an environment that promotes healthcare and well-being.  Very socially responsible.
cons:
Absolutely no opportunities for advancement in many departments.
Depending on the department you work for - management can be difficult.

pros:
Great lab facilities - spacious lab benches, windows 
Access to core facilities
Most major holidays off
cons:
Non-competitive salaries and personal time (16 days annually)
Diminishing benefits (significantly reduced sick time), annual increases in health/vision/dental insurance 
Basic science research secondary to the institute's other goals
Experiences will be heavily department specific:
Very little career progression available 
Heavy expectations for after hours and weekend availability 
Department has a history of not retaining talent (combined effects of mismanagement, lack of career progression and uncompetitive salaries)

pros: The staff and other employees that I worked with were great, the surroundings and facilities are magnificent, there was also a good balance of independence and supervision
cons: Some of these were probably because the position I was working was a summer college job.  The parking for non-senior employees was very far away from the buildings that I worked in, and the pay wasn't spectacular (but it was just a summer job). Those were the only two things that bugged me though.

job_title: Research Technologist I in Wauwatosa, WI
pros:
Very good lab experience for recent college graduates in biology, biochemistry, or related medical science.
Excellent benefits package, hard to beat!
Clean facilities for research.
cons:
Experiences vary greatly depending on direct managers/supervisors. 
Pay rates are relatively low, the great benefits may or may not make up for this depending on your situation. 
If you are a recent college graduate, professional growth will be limited at MCW. Consider it a college education you get paid for, it is not a corporate work environment.

review_title: Good graduate student stipend compared to cost of living
job_title: Graduate Research Assistant in Milwaukee, WI
pros: Excellent pay for graduate students compared to cost of living (though it is still a stipend and not exactly a good salary).  Generally laid back atmosphere with a culture of respect for nights and weekend.  Your experience will be highly dependent on which lab you are working in.
cons: I have not experienced any major cons being at the institution.

review_title: The Medical College of Wisconsin is the best employer I have ever worked for!
job_title: Reimbursement Analyst II in Milwaukee, WI
pros: Experience in all aspects of Medicine.  From research to Teaching Physicians and their Residents.
cons: The walk from parking lot to my office takes 7 minutes. It's actually a pro if the weather is nice.  We all need our exercise!

review_title: Generally a good place to work.
pros: Medical College has excellent benefits including dental, health and vision.  It is generally a good place to work and the people are full of excitement.
cons: As a postdoctoral fellow the pay is not what it would be in industry but I am gaining knowledge of a different area of science.

review_title: A Good Amount of Autonomy with Administrative Support
job_title: Clinical Research Nurse II in Milwaukee, WI
pros: I've enjoyed working at the Medical College of Wisconsin. I'm allowed a lot of independence in my role and I have the respect and support of management and my investigating physicians. I feel as if the adminstration approaches problems in a diplomatic manner that looks out for the good of the institution's growth and of its employees.
cons: Pay is slightly below average, but we are a smaller academic insitution.

review_title: MCW is a good place for a beginning postdoc to work.
pros:
Very interactive research.
Nice campus and buildings.
Lots of funding opportunities from the cancer center.
Easy to access.
The postdoc office is very good.
cons:
The pay is a bit on the low side.
The different departments have very different expectations.
Non-MD employees in the MD dominated departments were not valued enough.

review_title: I dodged the bullet! Senior AA in Surgical Oncology
pros: Some people were nice. I was a temp who received 1 day of training due to an emergency need. I was expected to know the job as if I had full training. I was promised if I did a good job I would be recommended for a permanent position; however, I was not given the training necessary to be efficient. Therefore, when I took to long to figure out where a document went, who should receive notification of a call, or how to upload CDs (because I needed to find someone myself to teach me) I was interrogated, questioned about the work flow I had, and my process for doing everything. If I asked how to do something, 99% of the time whatever it was, was taken out of my hand and I was told they (other AA'S) would do it. I was expected to know the urgency of certain documents and CD uploading without being told anything about the importance of the processes.
cons: There was no one willing to teach me anything. It was easier for the manager to come down and interrogate me rather than taking the time to teach me anything. If I asked one group of people, whom I was encouraged to ask for direction by the person who trained me for 1 day, I was reprimanded. I did not know the appropriate chain of command and I was doing what I was told to do. Nonetheless, at every turn, I was criticized. With every task that I made a small mistake in, that task was taken away from me rather than someone helping me understand how to complete the task and what the priority level was. This was once an organization I hoped to become employed with, today, I am glad I walked out. There was no way I was given what I needed to succeed, much less, the ability to do a good job and be recommended for a permanent position.

job_title: Clinical Research Coordinator I in Milwaukee, WI
pros: I really like the people I work with. The benefits are good and great vacation time for salaried staff.
cons: I don't get the sense that I will have much opportunity for upward mobility. Problematic employees are often given too many chances to shape up.

pros: This is a great place to work with great benefits. The managers in my department are great and let you do your job without micromanagement.
cons: The con is the pay. MCW pays well below what I would be making elsewhere with my experience and eduction

review_title: The Medical College of Wisconsin is a great place to work.
job_title: Clinical Research Coordinator III in Milwaukee, WI
pros:
Employees are valued and professional development is encouraged. Colleagues are great people--many became good friends. My department offered workshops and learning activities weekly. I had the opportunity to attend lectures multiple times per day. 
Great benefits! Generous vacation and sick days. Great insurance.
cons: The cafeteria leaves something to be desired.

pros:
-Advancement opportunities 
-Days off include “Black Friday” and Christmas Eve
-Food trucks come in the summer to give more choices
cons:
-Advancement opportunities come really fast if you know the right people
-Reduced the number the sick days a couple years ago, but possibly that was changed again since all this COVID-19 mess 
-Diversity and Inclusion remains a work in progress

review_title: Probably the best employer I’ve worked for
pros:
403b match
Great vacation benefits
Professional training & resources
Opportunities for advancement
Professionalism 
Mentoring
Great Mission
The People
Telecommuting options
cons:
Health benefits are not as good
Not a full paid parental leave policy
MD hierarchical mentality towards staff is sometimes challenging 
Less career support for staff (as opposed to faculty)
Limited flexibility with telecommuting with most leadership
Parking - new employees have to park off campus and take a shuttle

pros: Enjoy working here a lot, the team I work with is really great and over all the company is a nice company to work for.
cons: No cons at this moment. Depending on what it is that your looking to do long term, it may or may not be a long term place but there is definitely a lot of opportunities to grow and move up here.

review_title: Not for the faint of heart
job_title: Clinical Research Assistant III in Milwaukee, WI
pros: Great learning atmosphere for those who need to gain experience.
cons: Difficult to communicate with administration- they hear you but do not listen. You must always stick up for yourself because they do not have your back. Experienced employees leave because they are not competitively valued.

review_title: Overall, I would say that this job is a great resume builder, it is not a something I would like to turn into a career.
job_title: Research Technician I in Milwaukee, WI
pros: The benefits are great and my colleagues are awesome!!
cons: The pay needs to be more competitive.  The research is slow moving and at times it is hard to get motivated.

job_title: Customer Service Representative in Milwaukee, WI
pros: MCW provides a very organized structure, I was very satisfied with benefit package and the hours my job required. There was always a feeling of being a part of something bigger.
cons: In reviewing the job role, I don't believe there to be any "cons". The management was very upfront about expectations of the role and were more than willing to be train you.

review_title: A great place to work in Milwaukee with a high character workforce
job_title: Clinical Research Assistant in Milwaukee, WI
pros: High character workforce, great location, complexity of projects, ample opportunity to challenge yourself at different aspects
cons: Salary not always aligned with national averages, opportunity for career growth is limited, Milwaukee not the greatest city to live in

pros: I've been at Medical College for almost a year, there have been lost of changes, by overall it is a good place to work. As a former employee of Aurora, I have to say that Medical College offers more compensation.
cons: The department is always changing, micro-managing, favoritism, spreading staff too thinly ( need to hire more people and cross train)

review_title: It's great place for postdoc training, especially if you want to go for industry next
pros: There are well organized postdoc educational opportunities, and as a postdoc you get 15 vacation days and 9 sick days.
cons: there is no 401k matching for postdoctoral fellows, and depending on the lab you are in, you may not get the pay increase that is recommended by NIH.

review_title: Best MD's I've ever worked with
job_title: Medical Assistant II in Milwaukee, WI
pros: Excellent benefits. MCW is part of a teaching hospital, which is great for advancing in your career or possibly leading you to a new and fulfilling one.
cons: MCW is a partner of FROEDERT Hospital, so as a MCW employee you have to follow two different sets of policy and procedures in order to remain compliant daily.

pros: Wonderfu,caring physicians,good benefits,no weekends or holidays.
cons:
UNFAIR treatment of employees,manager is always right attitude,micromanagement,lack of appreciation for putting extra time in,ie coming in early,staying late,no lunches.No compassion when an employee is ill/off of work for a surgical procedure,etc.
Salaried position.

review_title: It is wonderful to work here. And Everyone is nice to you no matter where you come from.
pros: It is the only one private medical college in Wisconsin. Many professional people work here, and you can learn a lot from them.
cons: I do not know if there are any downsides in this college. Cuz I really have a great time here.

job_title: Research Technologist I in Milwaukee, WI
pros: Organizational values are superb.  This is a tremendous place to work.  Very high level of professionalism.
cons: In all honesty I am not able to think of one down side to this particular employer.  Supervisors are top shelf and very helpful.  I look forward to work every day.

review_title: I love being part of a company that changes lives!
pros:
Team player atmosphere where we strive together for a common mission! 
Great benefits 
Continuing to grow
Able to be a part of something greater than myself
cons: Sometimes feel our salary is in the lower end of the range. Sometimes feels disconnected from upper management. But overall a great place to work.

review_title: I performed data entry for MCW, but still enjoyed working there.
job_title: Laboratory Office Assistant in Milwaukee, WI
pros: Access to Children's Hospital cafeteria for discounted food.  Access to free weight room.
cons: Data entry was horrible, but that only has to do with the position, not MCW as a whole.

review_title: Good company, good benefits, good people
job_title: Quality Analyst II in Milwaukee, WI
pros: The department I'm in seems to be very family friendly, aiming to have a true work-life balance.
cons: Recent switch in vacation and Sick Time accrual. Went from 24 sick days per year down to 7 days. However, in the same move I went from 17 to 20 days of vacation time.

review_title: Obviously varies a lot from lab to lab
pros: Good administration in my department. Large institution with lots of resources. Decent pay and benefits. Opportunity to learn.
cons: Lots of work expected to be done in a short amount of time. Weekend and holiday work more frequent than purported at outset. Overwhelmed management took out their issues on others.

job_title: Animal Care Technician in Milwaukee, WI
pros: Still trying to think of any
cons: Micro management, supervisors allowed co workers to harass me. HR claimed being bullied was okay. I lost my hair from being bullied so badly. I was accused of harming the animals on purpose

job_title: Research Associate I in Milwaukee, WI
pros: Students are well prepared, given many oppotunities to present research, programs to encourage career choices and career development are well ogranized , encouraged to publish at least twice in high impact journals
cons: The institution offers little to no exposure to teaching and is discouraged. The long winters can get to you.

job_title: Laboratory Technician II in Milwaukee, WI
pros: You get to work with some very bright and fun people. The work is very rewarding and interesting. The cafeteria was pretty decent.
cons: There always seemed to be construction that could make it difficult at times to navigate either outside or within buildings.

pros: Being a part of a something bigger was always fulfilling. Being able to help patients.  Some of the faculty members I worked for appreciated me and praised me for my work.
cons: Micromanagement with both of the managers I had. A lot of employees complain about drowning in work and doing a workload that should be spread out between two or more employees. No advancement and must wait 1 year before applying or being considered for other positions.

job_title: Registered Nurse Case Manager in Milwaukee, WI
pros: I have the best manager you can ever hope for. She is forward thinking, insists on work life balance, and responds equally well to concerns and new ideas.
cons: Working for a medical institution that only offers an FSA, and not an HSA as part of the benefits = Disappointing.

job_title: Clinical Research Coordinator I in Milwaukee, WI
pros: Get your foot in the door of clinical research.  Professional environment.  People care about what they do.
cons: Salary is low, not much room for advancement.  Benefits aren't what they used to be.  High stress environment.  Frequent turnaround, workload always changing.

review_title: My experience at the Medical College of Wisconsin has been mostly positive.
pros: Some good reasons to work here compared to a traditional university are free parking, good insurance, and an in house cafeteria.
cons: Conducting research at the Medical college can be extra difficult because of the lack of hard money.

job_title: Laboratory Technologist III in Milwaukee, WI
pros: Hours are good. Good job stability. Decent benefits.  Other research personnel are friendly and extremely helpful.
cons: Limited room for advancement, low pay compared to national avg. Horrible HR department

pros: I enjoyed the people within my department. The pay  was decent enough for the work that I was doing.
cons: No growth or development opportunities. Not treated with respect from others outside of my department

review_title: MCW provides a highly professional, supportive and challenging environment for research.
pros: Many resources, excellent support of staff and trainees, clinical and basic researchers are highly collaborative, and there are many opportunities to advance.
cons: Some of the basic science labs are outdated, although many newer buildings have state-of-the-art labs.

pros: A Medical School that continues to emerge as a premier school.  Excellent benefit package.
cons: Toxic and unfriendly work environment and culture on campus.  Internal politics among the worst I have experienced in my career.

pros: benefits are OK and most of the "workforce" (post-docs, scientists and technicians) do their jobs
cons: Mafia style: HR covers management, management and PI's using postdocs and researchers like slaves. Doctors from Froedtert are the worst - they have big grants but no brains, so you have to run experiments designed by idio... hmm OK, not very smart people.

pros: pay is good, Most of the people are great to work with. Caliber of students is increasing.
cons: Very short sighted.  Difficult to move up if you are thinking and working outside the box.

review_title: How can a Medical College do such a terrible job providing its employees with decent health insurance?
pros: Salary is fair, AMPLE vacation and especially sick time.
cons: Cliqueish office culture.  Am I in high school again??

review_title: Medical College has much room for growth.  Leadership rewards talent and hard work.
job_title: Reimbursement Analyst II in Milwaukee, WI
pros: Flexibility in a salaried position.
cons: The walk from the back 40 (parking) takes 10 minutes. It's a pro in nice weather, a con when it's snowing/raining/cold.

pros: Salary, benefits, great people, sick days, coworkers
cons: Short breaks, constant management turnover,  no room to advance, little management support

pros: MCW provides a well-funded research infrastructure.
cons: The physical locations of MCW offices can be disconnected from the communities MCW intends to serve.

review_title: Good Experience. Compensation could be better.
job_title: Clinical Research Coordinator I in Milwaukee, WI
pros: Good benefits, lots of job opportunities
cons: Compensation is below average with no room to negotiate, necessary job training is minimal

review_title: Research here has lot of scope to learn and perform
job_title: RF Design Engineer II in Milwaukee, WI
pros: An encouraging employer offering lot of opportunities to learn and peform
cons: No increae in pay with experience gained

pros: Easy to come to work everyday when you have great peers and colleagues. Employer has good benefits. Easy to strike a work and home life balance.
cons: Compensation is not as high as in private industry.

review_title: Could be Better if they walk their talk
job_title: Senior Administrative Assistant in Milwaukee, WI
pros: Mediocre  work environment.
cons: Pigeon held in  position prevents from moving up with the company.  Zero work life balance in my dept.

job_title: Research Technologist II in Milwaukee, WI
pros: Good Benefits, great entry level experience. Can learn a variety of techniques that are valuable in the research industry.
cons: Pay is very low, raises are no where near what other companies provide.

pros: Benefits (health care, 403B plan, vac days), MCW is growing, numerous professional development opportunities
cons: Innovation does not seem to be a priority in general, leadership in some areas not strong

pros: Benefits are very competitive;
cons: They don't invest a lot in their employees as far as training and career advancement if you are staff.

review_title: Would recommend MCW, but not the CTO
job_title: Clinical Research Assistant in Milwaukee, WI
pros:
Able to utilize prior medical knowledge and Epic skills on a daily basis
Great coworkers, fun environment
cons:
Sitting all day, every day
Work is tedious and can be frustrating at times

pros: In the past, the Medical College of Wisconsin had a good reputation
cons: Poor management, no accountability, unprofessional staff with little integrity

review_title: Nice company to work for but individual experiences will be dependent on your specific department.
pros: Flexibility and easy to balance work/family/home life
cons: Salary and security- yet much of this goes back to NIH funding levels.

job_title: PATIENT RELATIONS Representative in Milwaukee, WI
pros: Good work environment, financially sound and stable company, good benefits.
cons: For being a large financially stable company I think health insurance deductibles and copays should not be so high.

review_title: One of the worst professional experiences I have ever had.
pros: The salaries are very generous.
cons: A very negative culture that is based on a discriminatory hierarchy.  Unless you are a physician, you are perceived as being "less than and lower on the medical food chain." Fear pervades the place and questioning authority ends quite often in dismissal.  In general, they do not practice what they espouse.

pros: Most employees are willing to work together to improve processes and move the company forward.  Very good benefits.
cons: Large employer so meet red tape now and then.

pros: The benefits are the best perk of working for this company.
cons: Title and promotions raises are slow and confusing levels of job descriptions.

job_title: Education Coordinator III in Milwaukee, WI
pros: Wonderful company with great initiatives and public service.
cons: Leadership in some departments are difficult to work with and often do not see the benefit of staff workers.

job_title: IS Project Leader in Milwaukee, WI
pros: Good work-life balance, good benefits
cons: Limited opportunity for career growth, IS policies and procedures are not centralized, IS is not viewed as a partner by other departments

job_title: Clinical Research Coordinator II in Milwaukee, WI
pros: One of the best research centers in Wisconsin. Great opportunities to learn
cons: Pay is not competitive and for the amount of work required, an incentive for hardworking employees would be nice

job_title: Research Associate I in Milwaukee, WI
pros: One of few options in Milwaukee for academic research.  Decent support for career development from the institution
cons: Still trying to find its way to be competitive with regional universities

job_title: Clinical Research Coordinator I in Milwaukee, WI
pros: I leave work every day with a feeling of accomplishment and I know my contributions are making a difference in this world.
cons: Pay is better at a non-academic institution.

review_title: Some of the PI's are two faced
pros: The people you get to work with aside from the PI's
cons: PI, faculty - some of them are amazing but there are a few that dilute the water.

job_title: Research Associate I in Milwaukee, WI
pros:
Great Benefits
Decent Pay
Laid Back Environment
cons: Unstable funding for research employees

review_title: Good company to work for; however, competent management is lacking.
pros: Excellent benefits and tuition reimbursement.
cons: Ineffective management. Insurance rates have increased yearly.

pros:
Relaxed atmosphere
I had a good boss, but it depends on your department
cons: Depending on your area/department there is not always a lot of room for advancement

pros:
-large academic medical center in Milwaukee with rich tradition and overall prestige
-strong resources to support faculty and faculty growth
cons: -despite strong efforts lacks a culture of inclusivity

pros: It is a very well known Business and offers a chance to move up into a position  you are interested in.
cons: Never had any problems there.

review_title: Great support and good mission visibility
job_title: Public Health Research Analyst in Wauwatosa, WI
pros: Support received from the biostatistics department was always top-notch and very responsive.
cons: Some clique-type behaviors were present, need to be careful around certain people.

job_title: Executive Administrative Assistant in Milwaukee, WI
pros: Great colleagues and leadership.
cons: Privately owned and can become a bit consuming outside of agreed work hours. No bonuses offered to administrators.

pros: Ability to move up. Great environment to learn from speakers, events, and other faculty and staff.
cons: The hierarchy and attitudes of some specialties can be tiring.

job_title: Research Associate I in Milwaukee, WI
pros:
Pretty much the best place for translational research in the Milwaukee area.
Benefits are good.
cons: I'm actually satisfied enough to not be able to think of any cons.

pros: MCW is a small campus but with is a vibrant research environment
cons: There are not many opportunities to remain here after graduation.

review_title: The Medical College of Wisconsin provides a collaborative environment for research-minded individuals
pros: Large network of interdisciplinary individuals; research infrastructure; friendly and engaging environment
cons: Micromanagement; some policies are outdated

pros: Stability, decent health insurance, ability to work remote a couple of days per week from home.
cons: Management/supervisors could make employees feel more respected and appreciated.

pros: Being a part of leading medical technology and training future physicians
cons: There really are none.  Depends on the department that you work in.

pros: Collaborative friendly environment with emphasis on teaching, research and clinical care.
cons: The rapid expansion is a good thing but may result in higher stress levels

pros: Awesome atmosphere, great people to work with, everyone is friendly.
cons: Not many cons. Have to park very far away when you arrive at work.

pros: Stable employment with predicable amount of work load

pros: Friendly and open environment with lots of interaction between departments
cons: Long weekend and late night work depending on labs and protocols.

job_title: Clinical Research Assistant in Milwaukee, WI
pros: Great work environment. and friendly atmosphere.

job_title: Research Scientist I in Milwaukee, WI
pros: The salary is okay and the living cost in Milwaukee is low.

pros: No micro management at all, work at your own pace with weekly deadlines.

pros: Can't work anywhere else in Wisconsin
cons: The place runs like "the old boy's club" of Marquette. The sleazeballs all protect each other and single out anyone who won't conform to their wants. This atmosphere does not foster creativity or original thought. The people with real talent leave.

pros: Good benefits.  The institutional mission is a good one.
cons: In the research labs there are not many options for advancement.

review_title: Excellent place to be a resident.
